turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: Just one word of advice for next season.

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: Never let a freshman take your spot.

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: I'm gonna love winning this championship in your house.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: How do you say "you're dreaming" in Italian?

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: Can you take that damn thing off the table.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You mean my championship trophy?  My bad.

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: Yeah, four years ago.  They had me staying in this tiny-ass town with like fifty people.  I'm not playing, there was about a thousand goats running around, and it gets dark at four o'clock.  Then the whack club I'm on loses three games in a row and I get blamed.  So they fire me.

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: Yup.  So I've been playing with this Italian club the last three years.

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: It's better.  Even though the whole first season my teammates didn't pass to me cause they were mad "The American" was making more money.  I led the team in rebounds cause it was the only way I could touch the damn ball.

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: So what are these Spanish guys like?

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: What?  You've been over here seven months and you ain't tapped anything?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Just not my type, I guess.

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: Shoot, Italian boys love them some black women.  They can't get enough of me.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You ever think about going back?

turns.speaker: SIDRA
turns.text: Sometimes.  But what's the alternative, not playing?  You remember big Toni?  She quit last year, now she's working at some bookstore.  I mean, look at us. They treat us like we're Hollywood stars over here.  We just played in the championship game.  It doesn't get much sweeter than this.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Told you I was nice.  I'm going to be the first girl in the NBA.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I'ma be in the NBA.  You're gonna be my cheerleader.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: It's this big hole.  You could almost see bone.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So how come you could play basketball?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I never knew a girl that could play.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: My Mom says she doesn't know where I come from 'cause I act different.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: My Dad plays for the "Clippers."  He says I'ma be a doctor or a lawyer, but I'ma play for them, too.  Same number and everything.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm going to be number thirty-two, like Magic.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: He's alright, but my Dad can take him.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: What was the most points your Daddy ever got in Junior High?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: One time Magic scored forty-eight points, and they only had six minute quarters and he sat out the whole fourth.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Well, if anybody bothers you, you could just tell me cause I run this street.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'd just tell my sister, Lena.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: She don't know how to box, I bet.  My dad showed me how to fight like Ali.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: What do I have to do?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I guess, you know, we play ball and we ride to school together.  And if you get mad at me, I gotta give you flowers.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: How bout Twinkies?  My mom won't ever buy them.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I think we gotta kiss now.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I want to ride my own bike.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: My Dad always drives my Mom.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So that means I have to ride with you.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I don't have to do what you say.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You're stupid.  And your Daddy plays for the worst team in the NBA.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Last time they won, Dr. J. was a nurse.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I know this.  What do you want?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Look, big head, I'll be at your car.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Some note Shawnee Easton told me to give to you.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Why she gotta be a ho, just cause she wants to get with me.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: She's a ho cause she's sending her coochie through the mail.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: And?  She's not saying, "I think you're a nice guy and I wanna get to know you better," she's saying, "I wanna bone."

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Yeah, an honest tramp-ass ho.  But I guess you'll stick your dick in anything.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Didn't know you cared so much.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So who you going to the dance with, Spalding?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: See, that's why you ain't getting recruited.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Who said I'm not getting recruited?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm not the one who put this scar here.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: When we were eleven years old cause he was about to lose.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: That's it, give it your best shot.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Would you watch the damn road?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I mean it, give it your best shot, cause I'm tired of you holding that over my head.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm warning you, don't tempt me.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I'm warning you.  You don't stall that bad attitude, no one's gonna recruit you.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Please, you jump in some guy's face, talk smack and you get a pat on your ass.  But because I'm a female, I get told to calm down and act like a "lady".  I'm a ballplayer, okay.  A ball player.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Didn't know you cared so much.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Yeah, the DJ's kinda whack, though.  So who is this clown?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Early night for you, isn't it?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I was about to ask you the same thing, going out with a college boy and all.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: So what dead-end street did you and Shawnee hit?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Well, I'm sure she kept her word and left you satisfied.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Cause I don't just stick my dick in anything.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: It was on my bed when I came in.  Can you just...?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You finish the reading for E-con?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Basically broke down how I'm gonna make mad loot in the NBA, me being such a limited commodity and all.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You do see me standing here, right?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I can't be nice to a fan?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I can't help girls coming up to me.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm telling you, Coach wishes she was here instead of me.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I don't have it easy like you, alright. There's no red carpet laid out for me.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So you're gonna act salty all night?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Who cares if you're never known as the first girl in the NBA.  You'll get more play behind Quincy McCall's woman anyway.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So how about a little one-on-one?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Don't put your hands in your pockets, hold your head up, always look a man in the eye, and all the time I'm hanging on his every word like he's God or something...

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I know he messed up, but that doesn't change what he's been to you.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: What has he been to me?  I mean, he looked me in my face and lied like it was nothing.  Like it was easy.  And I'm standing there getting loud on my mom like she's the one with no sense...

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: He even had me wanting to play for the "Clippers."  Man, how stupid am I.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I know a lot of brothers dog their wives, I just never thought my pops would do some shit like this...

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Nothing.  Why don't we walk to my dorm?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I'm not up for running into anybody. Let's just kick it here, alright?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Coach has us on eleven o'clock curfew. If I'm late, I don't suit up.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Didn't realize you were watching the clock.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I mean, I can stay a few more minutes.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: For real.  I should be alone, anyway.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I've been trying to find you all day.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: You think for once we could talk about something besides basketball?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Look, this party's whack.  You ready to go?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: You know what, I'm just gonna crash.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Yeah, sorry about that.  I had this meeting with this guy.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Yeah, I hit a three at the buzzer.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Oh, Kerry, this is Monica.  Monica, Kerry.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: We're going to get some food.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Are you out of your mind?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I just took the ho to Burger King, alright.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Least she had time for me.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: So you fucked around to prove a point!

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I just said I didn't fuck around.  But you got your head so far up your ass it took a cheap date for you to notice me.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: What, "Q-man", did I forget to kiss your ass like everybody else?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: That night you wanted to talk about your Dad I had a curfew.  What was I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: If I stayed, I wouldn't be starting!

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Least you got your priorities straight.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I never asked you to choose.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm a ballplayer.  If anyone knows what that means it should be you.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Well, if all you care about is basketball, why you fucking me?  Go fuck Dick Vitale.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: How do I know next time you're feeling neglected or whatever, you're not going to run around on me?  If we're going to be together I have to be able to trust you.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I'm not asking for us to be together.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I'm going through a lot of shit right now, more than you have time for.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: How are you going to tell me what I have time for?  I mean, whatever I did...we can fix this.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I decided to go pro.  And who knows where I'll end up, you know?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: When did you decide all this?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: So that's it, just forget about us?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Damnitt, Monica.  This ain't about us anymore, it's about me.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So...I guess I'll see you around.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Alright.  I heard you were in Spain.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I was.  I see your peach fuzz finally grew in.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: No, it looks good.  I mean, it's cool.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Shouldn't you be lying down, or...

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I'm alright.  But you can sit.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm fine.  My dad said you tore your ACL.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: A lot of things.  All I know is I'll be back in six months.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I thought a torn ACL was ten to twelve.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Still working on being the first girl in the NBA?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Well, I tried sneaking in after college, but they found breasts during my physical.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Tried calling you a couple times.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Wanted to give you props on making First Team All-American.  And then when Magic retired, I tried calling you again.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Must have been my cheap-ass answering machine.  It was always messing up.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Figured it was something like that.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm tired of playing overseas.  Thinking about giving it a rest for awhile.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Yeah.  Basketball just, isn't fun anymore.  You know?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Yeah, and Quincy, good luck with your knee, and everything.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Kyra's gone for a couple days.  Figured I'd keep Mom company.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Who's this guy I always see her around?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Strong enough to get you down the aisle?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Yeah.  Two weeks.  I didn't get to send you an invitation, but if you...

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: That's okay.  I'm probably, you know, busy.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Because I'm kinda feeling that way, too.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You had a rough couple years, that's all.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: That a nice way of saying I rode the bench?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: And you tore up your knee.  Rehab is tough.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Nah.  I haven't dribbled a ball in four and a half months.  Maybe I miss some of the attention, but besides that...

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Seems like I needed a ball when I was trying to be like my pops...or trying to be better than him.  Now, I kinda think I need to try something else.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I mean, Kyra hasn't heard the school thing yet.  She'll probably say it's the painkillers talking.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: It's a trip, you know?  When you're a kid, you see the life you want, and it never crosses your mind that it's not gonna turn out that way.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So why'd you give up ball?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Why do you keep asking me that?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: It doesn't matter, alright.  Just leave it alone.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You asked me what was missing.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: you woke me up to tell me that?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: It's not fun for me anymore because you're missing.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: What I'm trying to say is, I've loved you since I was eleven and the shit won't go away.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: We haven't talked since college and now you wait two weeks before my wedding to say something like this?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I know, I probably should have said it two weeks ago.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: You haven't changed.  You still think the sun rises and sets on your ass.  Well, guess what, it doesn't.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Then why are you so upset?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Because you don't pull this on someone who's about to get married.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: What's that supposed to be, psychology?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I know why you broke up with me in college.  And not that what you did wasn't messed up, but what I did was, too.  So if you forgive me, I'll forgive you.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Monica, after that stuff with my dad, I couldn't trust anybody, okay.  I mean, I was lost.  So you are forgiven.  But that was five years ago.  I moved on.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You once said the reason I beat you was because you wanted me to.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: So, if I win it's because deep down you know you're about to make the biggest mistake of your life, and deep down your want me to stop you.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: And what happens when you lose?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: If I lose, I'll buy you a wedding present.

turns.speaker: SHAWNEE
turns.text: Your hair looks so cute like that.

turns.speaker: SHAWNEE
turns.text: C'mon, girl, you live next door.  Who's been creeping?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: There's so many I just can't keep track.

turns.speaker: SHAWNEE
turns.text: Well, can you give him this for me?

turns.speaker: SHAWNEE
turns.text: I don't wanna look fast.  Thanks, girl.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: What?  Oh, and, uh, don't say "shit."

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Just you and Quincy, baby.  I got a meeting.

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: You just got back from a four game road trip.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Nona, don't start bitching.  I got maybe two years left to play.  I'm just trying to put some things together for us.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: I had some players to see and hands to shake.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: I'm not gonna get anywhere punching a clock just so my wife doesn't get an attitude.

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: I came second to the NBA.  I'm not about to come second to this bullshit scouting job.

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: I'm just saying it'd be nice if you found time for your family. You should see the tramps coming after Quincy.  If you don't talk to him...

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: You said you'd think about going back to get your degree.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: No, you said I should get my degree.  I like my "bullshit" job, okay, and it's gonna lead to a spot in the front office. Til then, don't worry, there's just enough savings to keep your ass in Gucci and gold.

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: Fine, then how many nights home is that?

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: The doctor'll be back in a minute.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Almost didn't recognize you with your hair like that.  How you been?

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: Happy.  And he won't want to see you.

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: I look like some hoochie to you?  I found it on your floor.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: What are you doing in my room?

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: Quincy, I told you about these fat-ass girls.

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: I'm not playing with you, these girls are looking to get you caught.  They see you, they see dollar signs.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Twenty-seven points, eleven assists and still undefeated.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I don't know, he had a meeting or something.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Don't sweat it, okay.  Sooner or later the truth'll come out.

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: Whose truth are you talking about?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Mom, we can't let something like this mess up the family.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: This is just about money, you know that.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I mean, how many times have you told me yourself to watch out for these ho's?

turns.speaker: NONA
turns.text: Guess I should have been telling your father.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So you're gonna take the word of some trick over Pop's?  He wouldn't lie.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Boy, what'd I tell you about using that word?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: "Can't" should never be in a man's vocabulary.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Cause when you say can't, you ain't a man.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Pop, there's no way an Ivy League Team is going all the way.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: I don't care about the team.  I care about the school.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Didn't we already have this conversation?

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: Yeah?  So you up for a game later?

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: I don't wanna hurt your feelings.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: You don't wanna hurt your back.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Anyway, I gotta get to this meeting. Tell your Mom I'm gonna be late.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Let's hope I can say the same about you one day.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Well, tell them to mind their damn business.  You're smart enough to get a degree.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I'm also good enough to go pro.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: You know how much higher the play level is in the NBA?  Give yourself time to develop, Quincy.  Get an education.  The NBA ain't going nowhere.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Your mom got pregnant and I had to make choices.  You don't have a choice.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Besides, the sooner you go pro, the sooner you'll have to deal with the mess I'm dealing with.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: there's this thing out there.  This paternity suit.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Some girl that's been hanging on at every party.  now I'm supposed to be her baby's Daddy.  Anyway, I told your mom I wanted to be the one who told you.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: I mean, it's not true, is it?

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: No, you need to hear me say it, I'll say it.  It's not true.

turns.speaker: QUINCY
turns.text: So what are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: I want this thing to go to court, but my lawyer's telling me to settle.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: A case like this could hang around for months and I'm up for this player relations job with the "Clips."  This gets out, false or not, no one'll touch me.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: We haven't exactly been living the fairy- tale life the past few years.  Something like this happens, it either brings a family closer or pushes them further apart.  We'll just have to see how it plays out.  I'm giving her some space, couple days...
